org.agilewiki.jactor2.osgi

Class FactoriesImporter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.agilewiki.jactor2.core.blades.BladeBase
      • org.agilewiki.jactor2.osgi.FactoriesImporter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Blade, ServiceChangeReceiver<OsgiFactoryLocator>

    public class FactoriesImporter
extends BladeBase
implements ServiceChangeReceiver<OsgiFactoryLocator>
    Imports an OsgiFactoryLocator from another bundle into the factory locator of the current bundle.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      The AsyncResponseProcessor for the start request.

      The service tracker used to find and then monitor the set of matching services.

      • startResponseProcessor

        private AsyncResponseProcessor startResponseProcessor
        The AsyncResponseProcessor for the start request. Once a match is found, startResponseProcessor is set to null.

    • Method Detail

      • startReq

        public AsyncRequest<java.lang.Void> startReq(org.osgi.framework.Filter _filter)
        Returns a request to import a matching factory locator.
        Parameters:
        _filter - A filter that should identify the single factory locator to be imported into the factory locator of the current bundle.
        Returns:
        The request.

      • start

        private void start(org.osgi.framework.Filter _filter,
         AsyncResponseProcessor<java.lang.Void> _responseProcessor)
            throws java.lang.Exception
        Wait for a matching factory locator, unless one is already registered. If more than one is found, reject the request. But once a match has been made and the factory locator is imported, any change to the set of matching factory locator's will stop the current bundle.
        Parameters:
        _filter - A filter that should identify the single factory locator to be imported into the factory locator of the current bundle.
        _responseProcessor - The AsyncResponseProcessor used to signal completion.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • startReq

        public AsyncRequest<java.lang.Void> startReq(java.lang.String _bundleName,
                                    java.lang.String _niceVersion)
        Returns a request to import a matching factory locator.
        Parameters:
        _bundleName - The symbolic name of the bundle.
        _niceVersion - Bundle version in the form 1.2.3 or 1.2.3-SNAPSHOT
        Returns:
        The request.

         java.lang.String _niceVersion,

        private void start(java.lang.String _bundleLocation,

            throws java.lang.Exception
        Wait for a matching factory locator, unless one is already registered. If more than one is found, reject the request. But once a match has been made and the factory locator is imported, any change to the set of matching factory locator's will stop the current bundle.
        Parameters:
        _bundleLocation - The location of the bundle (URL).
        _responseProcessor - The AsyncResponseProcessor used to signal completion.

        java.lang.Exception

      • serviceChange

        public void serviceChange(org.osgi.framework.ServiceEvent _event,
                 java.util.Map<org.osgi.framework.ServiceReference,OsgiFactoryLocator> _tracked)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Got a service registration change. Probably either we finally get the service we were waiting for, or we had it, and now it's gone.
        Specified by:
        serviceChange in interface ServiceChangeReceiver<OsgiFactoryLocator>
        Parameters:
        _event - The service event, will be null in the initial service change.
        _tracked - The available services.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
